--- title: "Intro to mixed models" --- ## Content - Fixed vs random effects - Blocking factors - Introduction to linear mixed models ## Learning objectives At the end of the session, students should be capable of - determining the structure of an experimental design with random and fixed effects - correctly determining whether effects are crossed or nested - correctly analyzing models with blocking factors - setting up a linear mixed model ## Readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 5 ([Complete Block Designs](https://stat.ethz.ch/~meier/teaching/anova/block-designs.html)) of @Meier:2022 (5.1-5.2) - [Chapter 6 Random and Mixed-Effects Models](https://stat.ethz.ch/~meier/teaching/anova/random-and-mixed-effects-models.html) of @Meier:2022 - {{< fa book >}} [Chapter 12](https://lbelzile.github.io/math80667a/mixed.html) of the course notes ## Complementary readings - {{< fa book >}} Chapter 4 of @Cox:1958. - {{< fa book >}} Chapters 10 and 15 of @Maxwell.Delaney.Kelley:2017. ## Slides

View all slides in new window Download PDF of all slides
